revisionDesc.change: Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Review and add annotations; update Bucke
Clean encoding (editor, date, remove "_large") and add standard annotations on unannotated files (Jeff W, Martha [Mattie], George W, Lou Haslam)

body.p: i will only write a very few lines this time i receevedreceived your letter to day wensdayWednesdayi withe with the contents all safe and i have been down to the post office and got the order changed it come good as we had got rather run ashore but walterWalter dear i had enoughf enough to get along i dont don't know how i should get on without you waltWalt but i suppose there would be some way they dont don't think that i have no way but what is given to me i suppose georgeGeorge thinks he finds me a house for his part well its good and i am thankfull thankful as we have never or not late years been fixed so nicely but at the same time we must have something else i have stood the hot weather pretty well it has been very warm indeed here and every where i suppose) i have had my face swelled and red and pricked so i dident didn't know what to doo do it is bloated some yet but dont don't feel such a heat as i have i think it must be the heat because i havent haven't been out in the sun so its not that) i have had a letter from jeffyJeffy and one from mattyMatty since i last wrote to you they both come emty empty but i suppose they have ways for all they have dont don't think i suppose mattyMatty says she is certainly coming on here this fall they have got intimately acquainted with a railroad agent so they think they can come free

georgeGeorge is away yet has been gone longer this time than any time yet i expect he will be home on saturday Saturday O waltWalt the papers came all safe i shall read them to night i am glad to get a paper i dont don't take any when georgeGeorge is gone only the little morning union a peny penny paper its better than none i beleive believe i wont won't write any more i feel so tired so good by Walt
